text: Hi All, Question for more experienced colloquies, a company send to us a HubSpot project for maintenance  and the project structure was written with this example <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate|cms-react-boilerplate > but now recommended way and more modern is this <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react|cms-react> there is a possibility to combine them or override the old one without brake something?

Overwriting won't work because the older CMS-react-boilerplate is an external dev environment (you build everything locally and upload the compiled files), while the newer CMS-React uses projects that are compiled in HubSpot.

If you only need to maintain it, I would leave it as it is and move to the new CMS-React only the parts that cannot be fixed or done previously.

While working with the new `Form` component, I noticed that if I used it in an `Island` and I had it in a modal component triggered after the main component mounts, it's not rendering. Do I need to add anything to be able to trigger the `Form` rendering once the modal component is mounted?
<@U0751URQUTW> you mean if I need a new component create it with new cms-react repository example add a project folder with rect app inside of old project ?
I would keep them separate, or if you do combine them, make sure that you exclude the HS Projects folder from the old cms-react build system (webpack)
I'm going to try to pick through the Github examples/docs and see if HubSpot has an official or recommended approach
